evidence: Project structure follows typical Django MVC pattern with models, views, and templates separated
Presence of models.py, views.py, and templates directories in each app
URL routing configuration files (urls.py) mapping to views
Template files (.html) organized in templates directories
Models inherit from Django's base models
Views handle HTTP requests and return responses
Static files (CSS, JS) organized in static directory
risks: Tight coupling between Django framework and business logic
Potential for fat models or fat controllers if not properly maintained
Limited separation of concerns compared to hexagonal architecture
